author: rafeki Kirk
text: 'Calm atmosphere very friendly staff good food and music'

text: 'Excellent food and service. Great bar
column5: extensive drink selection and fresh seafood. Nice atmosphere. Reasonably priced.   Would recommend.'

author: Tony Enrico
text: 'Great food'

author: A Google User
text: 'Service is good and fast
column5: oyster Happy Hour is amazing
column6: my new spot oyster spot'

author: A Google User
text: 'The host is a complete airhead. Specifically pointed out the table i was waiting for
column5: and he said okay just give it a couple of mins until they leave and the table is yours. After 20 mins the people left and as we were about to sit the waiter comes up and says the table is reserved. Very unpleasant experience before we even got to sit.'

author: tiffany Jones
text: 'Great happy hour until 6. Half off sparkling wine and oysters. Great selection of oysters. The food was ok. Not very seasoned. I was not impressed with seating. I made reservations as soon as the restaurant opened. We were sat in probably the worst seat (outdoors and table was on a slant) I informed staff and asked to change tables to one of the other outside tables
column5: since no one was there and we were the only ones outside. Staff informed us that they could not accommodate us because of other reservations. However the other reservations were not there and how would they know which table they have? Do people reserve specific tables ? I was annoyed and was not pleased with how this minor situation was handled.'

author: Andy Finneran
text: "Best oysters and raw bar in Hoboken! Cocktails are great as are the appetizers and entrees. People kept telling me their burger was phenomenal but I was always in the mood for their other entrees. Turns out the Burger is awesome too! Don't forget Happy Hour.."

author: Kay Ulanday Barrett
text: "Stingray lounge is a lovely light snack and dinner option if you want to treat yourself to lavish. The service was quick and helpful. The afternoon was quiet for 4pm and we chose indoor seating since the hit heat outdoors was distracting at the patio. We had a dozen of oysters at oyster happy hour and the most memorable were light and creamy like the sugar shack and the beau soleil. They were out of Kumamoto unfortunately.  We also went with brinier wellfleets!\n\nFor main meal we ordered a crab Cobb that was a good portion with chunks of crab and bacon which made a stunning combo with the crisp vegetables. The lobster Mac was deceptive. It looked small in a bowl but as you ate
column5: you realized that it was dense and rich and buttery. We went home with leftovers! Overall a great and yes
column6: an expensive experience. The restaurant was clean and followed covid protocols but the hand sanitizer was super scented like perfume
column7: that's my only gripe! A lovely hip date in Hoboken with outdoor options. Definitely recommend."

author: Zarah Thanasides
text: 'The tuna tartare was spectacular!!!!!'

author: Chloe Cai
text: 'Old Bay Fries
column5: spicy garlic shrimp and crab cake üëçüèº'

author: E Brown
text: 'Mike was awesome he checked in on us and made sure our food was good! Our server Lou was awesome and make sure the oysters we had were top-of-the-line!! Definitely will be referring people are coming back!!'

author: Scott Mazur
text: 'Great cocktails
column5: raw bar
column6: and service'

author: R
text: 'I‚Äôve been to this place many times. The food and service here is amazing! I have tried multiple different things off the menu and they all were perfect.'

author: Mariano Vega
text: 'great oyster bar'

author: Erika Bracy
text: 'Awesome little spot!  Great seafood! Great staff!'

author: AB
text: 'A major disappointment to say the least. I used to bartend for a long time and you‚Äôd think a place like this could at least do a dirty martini right... drinks did not taste that great (other than one); felt like my martini had soap and water in it tbh. We came here later at night and got the vibe we should hurry up and leave
column5: reminded a few times they were wrapping up (we were on a wait list before
column6: tried to go earlier). I know how it is
column7: tired and wanting to head home after a long day
column8: but please consider this isn‚Äôt about YOU
column9: it‚Äôs a customer experience.\n\nWe ordered the boil for 2...barely any crab
column10: a bunch of potatoes and sausage with a decent amount of shrimp in a watery broth with spice sprinkled in. This is a beautiful spot with nice decor
column11: and I think the idea of it is nice
column12: but I‚Äôd rather walk down Washington for good food/drinks
column13: than the 2ft it takes me from my apartment to here. Our waiter was amenable to requests & I appreciate that.'

author: RACS REMODEL
text: "Creative drinks and food was fantastic. From raw bar onwards. Try the scallops
column5: they won't disappoint"

author: Kevin
text: 'Big thanks to Mike
column5: Sebastien
column6: Frank
column8: and Santos for always taking care of us. Will always crave the oysters

author: Red Trust
text: 'Pricey... Food is mediocre at best. Drinks are meh! Beautiful setting though.'

author: Angela Cruz
text: "Second visit two Saturdays ago. Service
column5: wine
column6: cocktails and most dishes are excellent. However
column7: I must say that this time
column8: we were disappointed and very annoyed that their kumamoto oysters were extremely tiny... you pay a little over $4 each for an oyster smaller than the size of a quarter. They were good but it was even difficult to enjoy the taste because they were so tiny. They were definitely the smallest kumamoto oysters that I've ever been served or that I've ever seen. Other than that
column9: no complaints. I must say the ambiance is also very pleasant."

author: Nelson Mota (#MrSellyourhouse)
text: 'The service is great! But the food... OMG.. highly recommend the steamed mussels! Enjoy!'

author: Emily Raque
text: 'Excellent vibe for a lounge. Extensive bar offerings along with quality raw bar. Limited menue for food
column5: but very creative offerings. Excellent for a social night out. The service was excellent!'

author: Ashish Chowdhry
text: 'One of the best Oyster Bars on this side of the Hudson
column5: THIER food keeps getting better. The owner and his son stay on top of the service. Highly recommend. I think it‚Äôs better than some places in NYC. Well done guys!!!'

author: Safiya Lin
text: 'The food here is soooo good!! Drinks are nice and strong . I came specifically for their raw bar
column5: I got the little necks and tried each of their oysters! So delicious . I also got their scallop entree
column6: the best scallops I‚Äôve ever tasted. I still think about them üò≠ Out waiter was very helpful when it cane to explaining the different oyster types! I will definitely be back.'

author: John Bratowicz
text: 'Outstanding. Awesome service
column5: bar
column6: and food. Some of the best scallops and best Octopus I‚Äôve had.'

author: Meredith Williams
text: 'Happy Hour for cocktails is not included on Sundays. Even though they advertise it as such. Great oysters but if you‚Äôre expecting one price and end up with another
column5: it‚Äôs a punch in the gut. Food
column6: drink and service were good. Go for the Nova Scotia oysters!'

author: Alejandra ‚ÄúAle‚Äù Santana
text: 'From the beginning until the very end
column5: every bit was delicious. I had a great time here!!'

author: THGI
text: 'Excellent quaint place to quietly enjoy a good  selection of oysters
column5: including 2 locally harvested in the Jersey Shore
column6: as well as an ample selection of dishes and appetizers.  House cocktails are very very good.\n\nService and overall experience was enjoyable. I highly recommend this hidden Hoboken treasure.'

author: Eric Rodriguez
text: 'Best in town they where so good I chucked down about 36 oysters 12clams the service was on point my man sabastien\nRec. A IPA beer went so well he well knowledge on where the oysters come from be being a chef for 30+ years I really enjoyed everything'

text: "Food quality vs. price (specifically raw bar -- lobster is AWFUL) has declined as they've taken on their new COVID setting. Unfortunate. Not worth another trip...sad to see another solid establishment revert to just trying to make up money from their absence."

author: Tom Wang
text: 'It‚Äôs the best spot in Hoboken for both food and drinks. Loved the cocktails and the mussels were spectacular. Every oyster on the menu is quality! Staff super duper friendly
column5: all legends.'

text: 'Delicious and fresh food paired with excellent service.  Bartenders are very talented and seem genuinely happy when they nail a drink for you. Punk rock coming through the speakers made for a great night.  Anything from the raw bar was perfect. That burger at the end of the night topped it off perfectly a must try.'

author: Cathleen Babbit
text:
"Simple bar and seafood spot!

Guilhem (dry side)rose French wine complimenting the seafood here!

Beach plum tasted like it's been sitting. Beach point was my sea flavor favorite and Great Guns meaty were sized.  Mookie blues had sea flavor too.  I love seafood and oysters are aphrodisiac!  Island creek was of very fresh water like.  Blue point was the in between of meat and sea flavor. Slurpalicious!

Crab cakes were lovely as well as the clams oregenata.  One can't go wrong with the seafood here!  They have their signature hot sauce
column5: but it was hard to pour out!  It wasn't spicy to me
column6: but I only had a few drops out
column7: if that was the case.\n\nService was attentive and it was warm and cozy here (probably because it was non peak hours)."

author: Lindsay Sorin
text: "Sophisticated bar with classic cocktails & great oysters! Can't beat the happy hour specials. Absolute hidden gem in Hoboken."

author: Eric Riebesell
text: 'Love this place'

author: Courtney Gaertner
text: 'Casual spot for drinks and raw bar. Love it. Wait staff can be hit or miss
column5: so sit at the bar.'

author: Deanne Rae
text: 'I got off earlier than usual on a Monday and came here on a recommendation from a friend who lives in Hoboken. To my surprise they had half off oysters and sparkling wine from 4-8pm. Of course we got the oysters
column5: which were delicious. The mussels in a curry sauce was also delicious. Maxed out on shellfish we ordered the steak with chimichurri sauce
column6: which was  delicious as well! I would def come back here to try the rest of their menu and see what other oysters they have on rotation.'

text: 'Amazing place. A place to visit for when your are with your friends. The in-house offerings at Sting ray Lounge are fabulous. And the staff is very good and courteous. I will visit this place again without any hesitation for Cocktails.'

author: Jaymes Garland
text: 'The best. Start here for prestine cocktails and then head downtown for some Hoboken flavor. I recommend the oysters

column6: the oyster shooters
column10: and then flirt with the cute bartender. Oyster happy hour starts Sunday - Tuesday 4-8pm. Go this evening! But not before I do :p'

text: 'Cute looking place but the bartender seemed to hate his job
column5: didn\'t make any small talk or even smile. He and a female bartender spent their time chatting at the other end of the bar
column6: watching a football game. The female bartender even shouted a few times when her team made a good play (something to be expected from a drunk patron at a pub) not an "upscale lounge".'

text: 'I went there with a group of my friends.  We were happy that they got all our orders right and were nice to set everything up for us without reservation.  Nice atmosphere

author: rene echiverri
text: 'Awesome place to have oysters in this side of town... excellent service from Andre and kitchen staff.  Definitely will come back again.'

text: 'Definitely best cocktails in Hoboken
column5: hands down.  If your plan is to avoid the city but go somewhere with ridiculously good top shelf cocktails and tasty small plates this is your place.   Also
column6: ask the bartenders for some of their special cocktails that go on and off the menu - the bartender that was there was more than happy to make me some of those.  The ‚ÄúBreakfast Club‚Äù - espresso
column8: grapefruit and bourbon was unique and delicious!!!'

text: 'Worst grilled octopus I‚Äôve ever seen and or eaten. I had to eat it because I couldn‚Äôt believe how burned and how small it was.'

text: "Expensive

text: 'If you\'re seeking a more "adult" spot in Hoboken

column6: friendly bartenders
column7: this is the spot.  Make sure to ask about off-menu cocktails. Some raw bar available if you\'re in the mood. I\'m only removing a star for the narrowness of the space
column8: but that\'s being picky on my part.'

text: 'Good place to get some seafood and drinks at the same time. Live DJ

column6: and raw bar. Who can ask for more.\n\nThe staff is friendly and helpful suggesting drinks from the many options. Will be back.'

text: 'Awesome place'

text: "Nice atmosphere
column5: excellent food and friendly staff. On the negative side it's a bit pricey and I personally don't like the fact that they offer west coast oysters on the east coast when you realize how much they travelled whereas the Atlantic Ocean is right here.. Overall
column6: I definitely recommend this place."

author: David Cepeda
text: 'The seafood was fresh and delicious. The host was great in helping us select drinks. There is a huge list of drinks to chose from. It was a slower night when we went but I am told it gets quite lively in there. We wanted a chill night so it was ok with us. Will be back again with friends for a future visit.'

text: 'This is a hidden gem! The oysters beyond exceeded our expectations. We did the half priced oysters and chapagne on a Sunday night and had a wonderful time! This is going to become a regular place for oysters! The quality of the seafood is outstanding. Super happy!'

text: 'Great place!!!!\n\nThe oysters were so good
column5: fresh and delicious.  The place is clean and fun.  Definitely a place to come back.  The prices are good and the service is good.  We spend a really nice friend  time.'

text: 'Great mixed drinks.  Great vibe.  A little small.'

text: 'Awesome spot! Decor and overall ambiance is real unique! Bartender Andres is hilarious and paid superb attention to his clientele!! Definitely coming back again!'

author: Melissa C.
text: "I like it here. The cocktails are exceptional and the ambiance is chill. Their oysters are always fresh and they're half off Sunday through Tuesday and so is the prosecco! The music can be better but everything else makes up for it."

author: Phillip Stoner
text: 'Great cocktail list and classic rock music!'

author: Melanie Tam
text:
"Stingray Lounge is a hidden gem. I was really hesitating to write this review because I'm being selfish and don't want anyone else to know about this place. It's has four of my favorite things about a bar:

1. Cheap drinks
2. Seating
3. Discounted apps (in this case
column5:
50 cent clams on Thursdays)
4. Late HH (Sun-Thurs 5-10: 50% off draft beers on Thursdays)

My boyfriend and I came in on a Thursday at around 7:30 and there were still a few seats left at the bar. Stingray Lounge is small. There are probably about 10 bar seats
column6: and a couple of small tables in the back. It's definitely not for large groups but is a great date night spot.\n\nThe clams are such a great deal! They're comparable to NYC's HH $1 clams. They were plump and fresh tasting. On this night
column7: I discovered that I might be allergic to either horseradish or mignonette
column8: or at least an ingredient in there. Usually
column9: when I eat it with clams
column10: my throat gets super itchy. However
column11: Stingray's clams comes with neither of these - just lemon and cocktail sauce
column12: and these clams were fine for me. We also ordered some Old Bay fries on the side and it came with this great (homemade?) mustard dipping sauce.\n\nMy only peeve was that it took a bit longer to get their attention for another drink/the check
column13: but it wasn't the worst thing in the world. It's not like we were in a rush
column14: anyway.\n\nLooking forward to some more of those clams!"

author: Allie Gazda
text: 'Good cocktails and oysters
column5: can be pricey'

text: 'Oysters and martinis!! Great small plates.'

text: 'Great Raw bar.  Very relaxed spot to grab a drink; the cocktails are great!'

author: T R
text: 'Amazing food and even better drinks'

author: Kenya K Cook
text: 'I like the vibe of the joint.  The music was perfect and the ambiance made conversation easy.  The portions were small yet varied in selection.  I have a tough time finding oysters and the Stingray Lounge satisfied my jones.  The mussel and clams
column5: left me thinking this is how you stay thin.  Our small crew was split on the over experience.  I would go back.'

author: Johnson Wong
text: 'Cozy
column5: intimate space that is perfect for dates or romantic evening out. Cocktails have been on point every visit and a decent selection of beers or wines are available too. Still
column6: the highlight of this place is the seafood: fresh shellfish and tasty crudo are what keeps us coming back. Only wish there were more substantial food options - great appetizers and great nightcaps but only light sandwiches in between for entrees can make things a bit awkward.'

text: 'Great atmosphere. Very good Old Fashioned. Ask for the Willets rye.'

author: Nathan Daugherty
text: "has a good vibe
column5: nice decor. A long single bar makes interacting with others a little difficult
column6: but then I'm sure most people have friends. The music adds nicely to the overall ambience
column8: being able to talk to the person sitting next to you...assuming you're not alone like I am most of the time. The menu seems to have nice variety."

author: Diego Marin
text: 'Love this place! Fresh oysters and champagne are the recipe for a good nite. Definitely meant to be shared in small groups as space is limited and there is only one true table with mostly bar space. I recommend it to anyone looking for a good nite and/or to indulge in some diverse oysters.'

author: Ryan Vassallo
text: "Surprisingly not the freshest oysters I've had. Best for Hoboken other than Dino and Harry's of course. But the setup is absolutely awful in there. No seating at all but one table for 8 and the bar.  I understand there is next to no menue
column5: but I mean c'mon not everyone there wants to sit at a bar to enjoy some quality shellfish. it's not a bar item."
